column4: I have a question, how do you remove a program that was installed. I Installed google earth, and now i cant seem to uninstall it
depends on how you installed it
if you ran the installer as a user. I Think it installed to the 'googleearth' directory - If you did sudo.. no idea where it went
it might have an uninstall option. I use the repos that have googleearth
delete the diretory it made.. or rereun the installer and see if it has uninstall options
the google earth.bin is an installer.. it MIGHT have a --uninstall option
delete the diretory it installed to then.. and use the repos in the future. i guess
or chedk the google earth page for how to remove it
its not in the official ones.. its at meduibuntu i recall
you instlled it as sudo. sio its a system directory.. thus you have to do sudo rights to remove it
http://groups.google.com/group/earth-linux/browse_thread/thread/ad247e4963372efd?pli=1
itsbest to learn to do root things from the terminal. Running nautilus as root is asking for trouble
and there was no need to use 'sudo' to install google earth it can install to the users home.
i just installed google earth here.. thers an uninstall script in the googleearth directory
worked fine here.
yes.. the docs/url i posted said to run it from the terminal....
install mc and use it as your root file manager.. is one way.   sudo apt-get install mc, then sudo mc
or learn more shell basics. (always a good idea)
err.. of course.
partition the hd's to leave part unallocated -  that saves time.
or use 2 seperate hard driges
